title: FEC Filing Quizzes (Party)
description: Practice federal filing requirements for party candidates, focusing on FEC Forms 1 and 2.

tasks.prompt: Quiz: FEC Form 1 – Statement of Candidacy

questions.question: What triggers the need to file FEC Form 1?
options: Filing with the Secretary of State

questions.question: Form 1 officially declares a candidate's intent to run. True or False?

tasks.prompt: Quiz: FEC Form 2 – Statement of Organization

questions.question: Form 2 registers what for your campaign?
Quarterly reports (Form 3) must be filed after submitting Forms 1 and 2. True or False?

narrator: Once you raise or spend over $5,000, federal law requires you to file Form 1 (Statement of Candidacy) and Form 2 (Statement of Organization). This ensures transparency in campaign finances.
readingSummary: Crossing $5,000 in fundraising or spending triggers federal filing obligations.
Quarterly reports (Form 3) disclose contributions and expenditures.
Correct quiz answers earn Candidate Coins (CC) and signatures.
Incorrect answers simulate fines or credibility loss.

tasksDetails.prompt: Complete the quiz on Form 1: Statement of Candidacy
Complete the quiz on Form 2: Statement of Organization

sources: Federal Filing Guidelines for Party Candidates

outcome.description: Earn Candidate Coins (CC) and signatures. Completing Module 2 unlocks the General Election branch.
